definitions.definition: An undesirable fate; an impending severe occurrence or danger that seems inevitable.
A feeling of danger, impending danger, darkness or despair.
A sentence or penalty for illegal behaviour.

definitions.example: They met an untimely doom when the mineshaft caved in.

definitions.definition: (sometimes capitalized) The Last Judgment; or, an artistic representation thereof.
To pronounce sentence or judgment on; to condemn.
To destine; to fix irrevocably the ill fate of.
To judge; to estimate or determine as a judge.
To ordain as a penalty; hence, to mulct or fine.
To assess a tax upon, by estimate or at discretion.
